subject: Sleep
title: Cave Dwellers and Natural Sleep
description: One-minute skill: Cave Dwellers and Natural Sleep.

hook.text: Before artificial light, humans slept differently. And we know this because scientists put people in caves to find out.

buildup.text: In cave isolation experiments, subjects without clocks or light naturally developed a sleep-wake cycle of about 25 hours.

discovery.text: Without social cues, their circadian rhythm drifted, proving the internal clock runs slightly longer than 24 hours.

twist.text: Modern studies with hunter-gatherer tribes show they sleep about 6.5 hours, not the romantic 8 to 10 many assume.

climax.text: Our ancestors' sleep was shaped by temperature drops after sunset more than by darkness itself.

punchline.text: Natural human sleep may be shorter than our modern recommendations.

quiz.question: What did cave isolation experiments reveal about the human circadian clock?
options: It naturally runs slightly longer than 24 hours
